fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46923].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Summary
Users are able to edit any Space Questions as long as they have View permissions for that space. This includes questions asked by other users. Users do not need to have Space Admin or even Add/Edit Page permissions to the space, only View is required.

This is inconsistent when compared to global questions (not tied to any specific space) which require either Confluence Administrator permissions or specific permissions granted based on CQ points levels. (Source: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/QUESTIONS/Permissions)

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Environment: Tested with Confluence 5.7.1 + Confluence Questions 2.1.3.
# Create a question in a Space
# Log in as a different user with only View permissions to that space, and navigate to the question

h2. Expected behavior
The user will be able to view, but not modify, the question

h2. Actual behavior
The Edit option will be present, and functional, for this user

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46901].
  {panel}

Adding a message to https://answers.atlassian.com/cq/answerquestion.action I  got the error

Your post was rejected because it contains blacklisted words. Please contact the admin for more information.


Message was an answer:

Well, Atlassian Summit is in early November this year. Most years have a big release of JIRA just before Summit. So it would not surprise me if that happened again this year.

Older thoughts about guessing release dates are at http://jiradev.blogspot.com/2010/09/signs-that-new-version-of-jira-is.html


I'd also expect more info about which words were not ok

The documentation lists the points as:
25 points when your answer is accepted
15 points each time your question or answer is upvoted
-2 points each time your question or answer is down voted. 

The correct points are:
15 points when your answer is accepted
10 points each time your question or answer is upvoted
-2 points each time your question or answer is down voted.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46864].
  {panel}

A direct object reference vulnerability exists on the answers.atlassian.com platform which allows for malicious users to obtain the email address of any given ID. 

Additionally since the ID's are incremental, it would be possible for an attacker to gain the email addresses of every single Atlassian Answers user.

If the Atlassian Answers systems are linked with the main Atlassian identification system, it may be likely that every Atlassian users email address is exposed to any user.

By making the following request where [id] is modified in the GET request path, any users email address is able to be obtained:

{noformat}
GET /api/users/[id]/ HTTP/1.1
Host: answers.atlassian.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:29.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/29.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
X-CSRFToken: 6f6f820e0235bec839d1c48a049e4d89
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Referer: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/299003/
Cookie: [redacted]
Connection: keep-alive
{noformat}

the following response is obtained:
{noformat}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx
Date: Mon, 26 May 2014 10:56:41 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Connection: close
Vary: Authorization,Cookie
X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
Content-Length: 581
{
    "username": "[fullname]", 
    "website": "", 
    "about": "", 
    "links": {
        "badges": "/users/[id]/badges", 
        "self": "/users/[id]", 
        "questions": "/users/[id]/questions", 
        "answers": "/users/[id]/answers"
    }, 
    "tags": [], 
    "organisation": "Atlassian", 
    "answers": [no], 
    "id": [id], 
    "karma": [no], 
    "questions": 0, 
    "following": false, 
    "last_seen": "[date]", 
    "date_joined": "[date]", 
    "email": "*[email]*", 
    "badges": [no], 
    "location": ""
}
{noformat}

I was able to confirm that this vulnerability affects approximately 170,000 Atlassian users, however did not retrieve the details of accounts in the masses.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46862].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Confluence Questions generate a StackOverFlowError stack trace when an Answer containing an Attachment is converted to a Comment

h3. Environment
* 6.0.0-OD-2016.07.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to one question and attach PDF/Image/file to Answer 
# Submit answer and then convert the Answer to a Comment

h3. Expected Results
Questions post loads without error

h3. Actual Results
Attached Log: StackOverFlowError.txt
 
h3. Notes
Appears that if the file is initially added on a Comment, this error does not occur and the Comment can be converted to an Answer and back to a Comment

h3.Workaround

_In Cloud instances, this would need to be performed by Support_
- Remove the Attachment on the Comment
or 
- Convert the Comment containing an Attachment back to an Answer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46856].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to https://answers.atlassian.com/account/signin/ 
2. Click "Create an Atlassian Account"
3. Taken to https://id.atlassian.com/profile/signUp.action?application=aac&continue=https://answers.atlassian.com/account/signin/
4. Fill out form to create a new account
5. Taken back to https://answers.atlassian.com/account/signin/
6. Sign in with newly created account credentials
7. Taken to https://answers.atlassian.com/account/register/
8. Specify Display Name and submit form
9. Unexpectedly taken to https://id.atlassian.com/profile/signUp.action?application=aac&continue=https://answers.atlassian.com/account/signin/

At this point, if the user returns to AAC, they are signed in and their newly created Display Name is visible in the header. The issue is the unexpected redirect in step #9.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46804].
  {panel}

Hi,

The question https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/247468/is-there-a-way-to-make-it-so-that-there-is-one-notification-per-24-hours keeps sending notifications every 10 seconds or so, since 24 hours.

We're at 2000 emails, and it keeps sending. Also, there are 147 followers for that question.

I shall suggest to suspend the mail server, maybe?

Also I have a request for my karma: It has not been incremented 2000 times ;)

Best regards,
Adrien
